links.title: Solar And Wind Charged Batteries Are Now Popping Up On Electrical Grids
links.description: When Superstorm Sandy swept ashore on the U.S. East Coast in October of 2012, almost 8 million customers, from the Carolinas to Canada, lost power. Yet, if you could have looked at a cloud-free satellite photo the night after the hurricane, you would have seen "islands" of light in the darkness.

messages.body: $TSLA Negative nellies what say you?  Tesla’s massive battery in Australia was paid up to $1000/MWh to charge itself https://electrek.co/2018/01/14/teslas-massive-battery-in-australia-was-paid-up-to-1000-mwh-to-charge-itself/

links.title: Tesla's massive battery in Australia was paid up to $1000/MWh to charge itself
links.description: Yesterday, Saturday 13th, in South Australia the Tesla battery at Hornsdale Power Reserve was paid AU$1,000/MWh (USD$790/kWh) to absorb excess electricity from the power grid. The battery has become famous for coming online in under 100 days after an Elon Musk Twitter bet and later reacting to a crashed coal plants in milliseconds.

links.title: Ford to increase electric vehicle investment to $11 billion: executive
links.description: (Reuters) - Ford Motor Co () will increase to $11 billion its investments in electric vehicles, Jim Farley, the company's head of global markets, said on Sunday at the Detroit auto show. Farley said Ford will bring a high performance electric utility vehicle to market by 2020.
